ground_truth: A couple stands by the window; one man gets up from his chair and walks away. Some guests sip their drinks, smiling, as the camera moves back to the piano and the book-laden wall. Evan is playing the piano with exuberance while Norma, still standing behind him, has a poignant, wistful expression on her face. Mavis the maid walks by with a tray of hors d'oeuvres, and the man takes one, mouthing his thanks, as the camera travels past the open bookshelf, past two boys in suits who are drinking soda and munching, to reveal Lee. She is leaning against another doorway, a faraway look on her face as she listens to the music. Mavis passes in the hall beyond the doorway. Several people, deep in conversation, stand nearby as Elliot, holding a drink, walks up behind her. Lee slips past Elliot and walks away. Elliot looks back at her briefly, then, sipping his drink, he turns and looks offscreen at the crowd in the living room. Holly is standing in the pantry, preparing some offscreen food when Hannah walks into view, headed for the refrigerator, carrying two tomatoes. Hannah opens the refrigerator, totally ignoring Holly, then walks over to the table, gathering up more food. Holly walks over to the sink and washes her hands, drying them as Hannah, her arms laden with vegetables, strides over to her sister. Hannah storms out a nearby door as Holly turns away from the sink. Holly wipes her hand on the towel as Hannah reenters the kitchen, carrying even more vegetables, and strides into the pantry area, flopping the vegetables down on the counter. Holly puts the dishtowel down and absently straightens some things on the food-laden table. Hannah angrily gathers up some spices from the table; Holly walks back onscreen holding a silver ice bucket, stops at the corner of the table, and faces Hannah. Hannah picks up a large bowl and carries it, along with her armload of spices, into the pantry area. Hannah, reacting, puts the spices down on the pantry counter while Holly turns away. Guests can be seen mingling and talking and helping themselves at a buffet table in the living room. Lee and Elliot can be heard offscreen as the camera slowly moves from the doorway across the empty dining room to reveal them in the midst of an intense conversation. Lee goes over to an open door and closes it quickly. The door opens and Mavis appears, holding a set of candlesticks. She walks over to the dining room table, which is already decked out with a floral centerpiece, glassware, and china, and puts them down as Lee and Elliot stand awkwardly near the door, waiting for her to leave.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: A pair remains by the casement; one gentleman rises up from his seat and strolls away. Several attendees sip their beverages, grinning, as the lens shifts back to the keyboard and the volume-filled partition. Evan is performing on the keyboard with enthusiasm while Norma, still positioned behind him, has a touching, longing demeanor on her visage. Mavis the servant ambles by with a platter of appetizers, and the gentleman takes one, mouthing his gratitude, as the camera travels past the open bookshelf, past two lads in attire who are sipping soda and nibbling, to disclose Lee. She is leaning against another portal, a distant look on her countenance as she listens to the melody. Mavis passes in the corridor beyond the doorway. Several individuals, engaged in discourse, stand nearby as Elliot, holding a beverage, approaches behind her. Lee slips past Elliot and wanders away. Elliot glances back at her momentarily, then, sipping his beverage, he turns and gazes offscreen at the assembly in the sitting room. Holly is standing in the storeroom, preparing some offscreen nourishment when Hannah walks into sight, headed for the icebox, carrying two tomatoes. Hannah opens the icebox, totally ignoring Holly, then walks over to the table, gathering up more sustenance. Holly walks over to the basin and cleans her hands, drying them as Hannah, her arms laden with produce, strides over to her sibling. Hannah storms out a nearby door as Holly turns away from the basin. Holly wipes her hand on the cloth as Hannah reenters the kitchen, carrying even more produce, and strides into the pantry area, flopping the produce down on the counter. Holly puts the cloth down and absentmindedly straightens some items on the food-laden table. Hannah angrily gathers up some seasonings from the table; Holly walks back onscreen holding a silver ice pail, stops at the corner of the table, and faces Hannah. Hannah picks up a large bowl and carries it, along with her armload of seasonings, into the pantry area. Hannah, reacting, puts the seasonings down on the pantry counter while Holly turns away. Guests can be seen mingling and chatting and helping themselves at a buffet table in the living room. Lee and Elliot can be heard offscreen as the camera slowly moves from the doorway across the vacant dining room to reveal them in the midst of a passionate dialogue. Lee goes over to an open door and closes it swiftly. The door opens and Mavis appears, holding a set of candlesticks. She walks over to the dining room table, which is already decked out with a floral centerpiece, glassware, and china, and places them down as Lee and Elliot stand awkwardly near the door, waiting for her to depart.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: A couple is stood by the window; a chair is vacated by one man and away he walks. Drinks are sipped by some guests, smiling, as the camera is moved back to the piano and the book-laden wall is shown. The piano is being played with exuberance by Evan while Norma, who is still standing behind him, wears a poignant, wistful expression on her face. A brief look is cast back at her by Elliot, then, his drink he sips, and offscreen at the crowd in the living room he looks. In the pantry, Holly is preparing some food offscreen when Hannah comes into view, headed for the refrigerator and carrying two tomatoes. The refrigerator is opened by Hannah, totally ignoring Holly, then more food is gathered up from the table by her. The sink is approached by Holly and her hands are washed, dried them are as Hannah, her arms laden with vegetables, strides over to her sister. The door nearby is stormed out by Hannah as Holly turns away from the sink. Holly wipes her hand on the towel as more vegetables are carried by Hannah as she reenters the kitchen and strides into the pantry area, the vegetables flopped down on the counter. The dishtowel is placed down by Holly and some things on the food-laden table are absently straightened. Some spices are angrily gathered up by Hannah from the table; onscreen walks back Holly holding a silver ice bucket, the corner of the table is stopped at, and she faces Hannah. A large bowl is picked up by Hannah and it is carried, along with her armload of spices, into the pantry area. The spices are put down by Hannah, reacting, on the pantry counter while Holly turns away. Guests mingle and talk and help themselves at a buffet table in the living room. Offscreen, Lee and Elliot are heard as the camera slowly moves from the doorway across the empty dining room to reveal them in the midst of an intense conversation. Lee goes over to an open door and quickly it is closed by her. The door is opened and Mavis appears, holding a set of candlesticks. The dining room table, which is already decked out with a floral centerpiece, glassware, and china, is walked over to by her, and down they are put by her as Lee and Elliot stand awkwardly near the door, waiting for her to leave.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: A couple stands by the window; one man rises and walks away. Guests sip drinks, smiling, as the camera returns to the piano and book-laden wall. Evan plays the piano energetically while Norma, behind him, looks wistful. Mavis the maid passes with hors d'oeuvres, and a man takes one, mouthing thanks. The camera moves past an open bookshelf and two boys in suits drinking soda, revealing Lee leaning against a doorway, lost in thought, listening to the music. Mavis walks by in the hall. Nearby, people converse as Elliot, holding a drink, approaches Lee. She slips past him and walks away. Elliot briefly watches her, then looks at the living room crowd. Holly is in the pantry preparing food when Hannah enters, carrying tomatoes. Ignoring Holly, Hannah opens the refrigerator, gathers more food, and storms out. Holly dries her hands as Hannah reenters with more vegetables, placing them in the pantry. Holly straightens items on the table. Hannah angrily collects spices; Holly returns with an ice bucket, facing Hannah. Hannah carries a bowl and spices into the pantry, reacting as Holly turns away. Guests mingle at a buffet table in the living room. Offscreen, Lee and Elliot are heard as the camera moves to reveal them in an intense conversation. Lee closes an open door. Mavis enters with candlesticks, placing them on a dining table set with a floral centerpiece, glassware, and china, as Lee and Elliot wait awkwardly for her to leave.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: A couple stands by the window; a man rises and walks away. Guests sip drinks, smiling, as the camera returns to the piano and book-laden wall. Evan plays the piano exuberantly while Norma, behind him, looks wistful. Mavis the maid passes with hors d'oeuvres; a man takes one, mouthing thanks. The camera moves past an open bookshelf, two boys in suits drinking soda, to reveal Lee, leaning against a doorway, listening to music. Mavis passes in the hall. Nearby, people converse as Elliot, with a drink, approaches Lee. She slips past him, and he briefly watches her before looking at the living room crowd. Holly prepares food in the pantry as Hannah enters with tomatoes, ignoring Holly, and gathers more food. Holly washes her hands as Hannah, arms full of vegetables, storms out. Hannah returns with more vegetables, flopping them on the counter. Holly straightens the table, and Hannah angrily gathers spices. Holly, with an ice bucket, faces Hannah, who carries a bowl and spices to the pantry. Guests mingle at a buffet in the living room. Offscreen, Lee and Elliot converse intensely. Lee closes a door quickly. Mavis enters with candlesticks, placing them on a table with a floral centerpiece, glassware, and china, as Lee and Elliot wait awkwardly.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: A couple is standing by the window, and one of the men rises from his chair and walks away. Meanwhile, some guests are leisurely sipping their drinks, smiling contentedly, as the camera gracefully pans back to focus on the piano and the wall filled with books. Evan is energetically playing the piano with great exuberance, while Norma, who is still standing behind him, wears a poignant and wistful expression on her face. Mavis, the maid, walks by carrying a tray laden with hors d'oeuvres, and the man takes one, mouthing his thanks, as the camera glides past the open bookshelf, past two boys dressed in suits who are drinking soda and munching on snacks, to reveal Lee. She is leaning against another doorway, a distant look on her face as she listens intently to the music. Mavis passes by in the hallway beyond the doorway. Several people, deeply engaged in conversation, stand nearby as Elliot, holding a drink in his hand, approaches from behind her. Lee slips past Elliot and walks away. Elliot briefly glances back at her, then, sipping his drink, he turns and looks offscreen at the crowd gathered in the living room. Holly is standing in the pantry, busy preparing some food that is offscreen when Hannah walks into view, heading for the refrigerator, carrying two tomatoes. Hannah opens the refrigerator, completely ignoring Holly, then walks over to the table, gathering up more food items. Holly walks over to the sink and washes her hands, drying them as Hannah, her arms laden with vegetables, strides over to her sister. Hannah storms out through a nearby door as Holly turns away from the sink. Holly wipes her hand on the towel as Hannah reenters the kitchen, carrying even more vegetables, and strides into the pantry area, flopping the vegetables down on the counter. Holly puts the dishtowel down and absently straightens some things on the table, which is laden with food. Hannah, with an angry demeanor, gathers up some spices from the table; Holly walks back onscreen holding a silver ice bucket, stops at the corner of the table, and faces Hannah. Hannah picks up a large bowl and carries it, along with her armload of spices, into the pantry area. Hannah, reacting, puts the spices down on the pantry counter while Holly turns away. Guests can be seen mingling, talking, and helping themselves at a buffet table in the living room. Lee and Elliot can be heard offscreen as the camera slowly moves from the doorway across the empty dining room to reveal them in the midst of an intense conversation. Lee goes over to an open door and closes it quickly. The door opens again, and Mavis appears, holding a set of candlesticks. She walks over to the dining room table, which is already beautifully decked out with a floral centerpiece, glassware, and fine china, and puts them down as Lee and Elliot stand awkwardly near the door, waiting for her to leave.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: A couple is positioned by the window, and at that moment, one of the men gets up from his chair and gracefully walks away. Meanwhile, several guests are casually sipping their drinks with a calm air, smiling with satisfaction, as the camera smoothly pans back to bring the piano and the wall adorned with numerous books into focus. Evan is energetically playing the piano with vibrant enthusiasm, while Norma, who remains standing behind him, wears a deeply poignant and wistful expression on her face. Mavis, the attentive maid, passes by carrying a tray heavily laden with delicious hors d'oeuvres, and the man takes one, mouthing his thanks appreciatively, as the camera glides past the open bookshelf. It moves past two boys, both dressed smartly in suits, who are drinking soda and munching on snacks, until it reveals Lee. She is leaning comfortably against another doorway, a distant and contemplative look on her face as she listens intently to the music. Mavis is seen passing by in the hallway beyond the doorway. Several people, deeply absorbed in conversation, stand close by as Elliot, with a drink in his hand, approaches from behind her with a casual air. Lee skillfully slips past Elliot and quietly walks away. Elliot briefly glances back at her, then, sipping his drink thoughtfully, he turns and gazes offscreen at the lively crowd gathered in the living room. Meanwhile, Holly is standing in the pantry, busy preparing some food that remains offscreen when Hannah comes into view, heading determinedly for the refrigerator, carrying two ripe tomatoes. Hannah opens the refrigerator, completely ignoring Holly, then purposefully walks over to the table, gathering up more food items with ease. Holly walks over to the sink, where she washes her hands and dries them as Hannah, her arms now laden with an assortment of vegetables, strides over to her sister. Hannah storms out through a nearby door as Holly turns away from the sink. Holly wipes her hand on the towel, and as Hannah reenters the kitchen, carrying even more vegetables, she strides into the pantry area, flopping the vegetables down on the counter with a sense of urgency. Holly puts the dishtowel down and absently straightens some items on the table, which is heavily laden with an array of food. Hannah, with an evidently angry demeanor, gathers up some spices from the table; Holly walks back onscreen holding a shiny silver ice bucket, and she stops at the corner of the table, facing Hannah directly. Hannah picks up a large bowl and carries it, along with her armload of spices, into the pantry area. Reacting to the situation, Hannah puts the spices down on the pantry counter while Holly turns away. Guests can be seen mingling, engaging in conversation, and helping themselves to a buffet table in the lively living room. Offscreen, Lee and Elliot can be heard as the camera slowly moves away from the doorway across the empty dining room to reveal them deeply engaged in an intense conversation. Lee moves over to an open door and quickly closes it. The door opens once more, and Mavis appears, holding a pair of elegant candlesticks. She walks over to the dining room table, which is already beautifully adorned with a floral centerpiece, fine glassware, and exquisite china, and she gently puts the candlesticks down as Lee and Elliot stand awkwardly near the door, waiting for her to leave.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: A couple stands by the window, their presence a silent backdrop to the unfolding scene. One man, seated comfortably, decides to rise from his chair, pushing it back slightly as he stands and then walks away with a purposeful stride. Meanwhile, some guests, seated or standing nearby, lift their glasses to their lips, sipping their drinks with a sense of enjoyment, their faces adorned with smiles. The camera, capturing these moments, begins to shift its focus, moving back to reveal the piano and the wall lined with books. At the piano, Evan is fully immersed in his performance, his fingers dancing across the keys with exuberance, while Norma stands behind him, her face a canvas of poignant, wistful emotions as she listens. Mavis, the maid, enters the scene, walking by with a tray laden with hors d'oeuvres. A man, noticing her, reaches out to take one, mouthing his thanks in silent gratitude. The camera continues its journey, gliding past the open bookshelf and two boys dressed in suits, who are enjoying their sodas and snacks, to reveal Lee. She is leaning against another doorway, her expression distant and contemplative as she absorbs the music. In the background, Mavis can be seen passing through the hall beyond the doorway. Nearby, several people are engaged in deep conversation, their voices a soft murmur in the background. Elliot, holding a drink, approaches from behind Lee. Sensing his presence, Lee deftly slips past him and walks away. Elliot, momentarily caught off guard, glances back at her, then, with a sip of his drink, turns his attention to the crowd gathered in the living room. In the pantry, Holly is busy preparing food that remains out of view when Hannah enters, carrying two tomatoes. Without acknowledging Holly, Hannah opens the refrigerator, retrieves what she needs, and moves to the table to gather more food. Holly, meanwhile, walks over to the sink, turns on the water, and washes her hands, drying them with a towel. Hannah, her arms now full of vegetables, strides over to her sister, her movements brisk and determined. She storms out through a nearby door, leaving Holly to turn away from the sink, wiping her hands on the towel. Hannah soon reenters the kitchen, carrying even more vegetables, and heads into the pantry area, where she unceremoniously drops the vegetables onto the counter. Holly, having put down the dishtowel, absently straightens some items on the food-laden table. Hannah, her frustration evident, gathers up some spices from the table. Holly reappears, holding a silver ice bucket, and stops at the corner of the table, facing Hannah. Hannah picks up a large bowl, balancing it with her armload of spices, and carries everything into the pantry area. There, she reacts by placing the spices down on the counter while Holly turns away. In the living room, guests mingle, converse, and help themselves to the offerings at a buffet table. Offscreen, the voices of Lee and Elliot can be heard as the camera slowly pans from the doorway across the empty dining room, eventually revealing them engaged in an intense conversation. Lee, feeling the need for privacy, moves to an open door and closes it quickly. The door soon opens again, and Mavis appears, holding a set of candlesticks. She walks over to the dining room table, already adorned with a floral centerpiece, glassware, and china, and places the candlesticks down. Lee and Elliot stand awkwardly near the door, waiting for Mavis to leave so they can continue their conversation.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: A couple stands by the window as one man departs. Guests enjoy their drinks with smiles while the camera pans to Evan, who plays the piano energetically, accompanied by Norma's wistful gaze. Mavis the maid offers hors d'oeuvres, and a man accepts one with gratitude. The camera moves past a bookshelf and two boys enjoying soda and snacks, revealing Lee, who listens to the music with a distant expression. Mavis passes by in the hallway as Elliot approaches Lee, who then slips away. Elliot briefly watches her before turning his attention to the living room crowd. In the pantry, Holly prepares food as Hannah enters, carrying tomatoes. Ignoring Holly, Hannah retrieves more food from the refrigerator. Holly washes her hands, and Hannah, arms full of vegetables, exits and reenters the kitchen, placing them on the counter. Holly tidies the table while Hannah gathers spices, and Holly returns with an ice bucket, facing Hannah. Hannah moves a bowl and spices to the pantry, reacting as Holly turns away. Guests mingle at the buffet in the living room. The camera shifts to Lee and Elliot in an intense conversation, which pauses as Lee closes a door. Mavis enters with candlesticks, placing them on the dining table adorned with a floral centerpiece, glassware, and china, while Lee and Elliot wait for her to leave.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: A couple stands by the window in the softly lit room; one man, wearing a tailored suit indicative of the evening's formal dress code, gets up from his chair and walks away. Some guests, dressed in cocktail attire reminiscent of a sophisticated gathering, sip their drinks, smiling, as the camera moves back to the grand piano, a Steinway known for its rich sound and craftsmanship, and the book-laden wall, an extensive collection curated over years by a literary enthusiast. Evan is playing the piano with exuberance, his fingers dancing across the keys with the skill of a classically trained musician, while Norma, still standing behind him, has a poignant, wistful expression on her face, perhaps remembering a past era when music filled her home. Mavis the maid, in her crisp uniform, walks by with a tray of hors d'oeuvres like smoked salmon and caviar, and the man takes one, mouthing his thanks, as the camera travels past the open bookshelf, past two boys in suits who are drinking soda from crystal glasses and munching on canapés, to reveal Lee. She is leaning against another doorway, a faraway look on her face as she listens to the music, lost in thoughts of a distant memory. Mavis passes in the hall beyond the doorway, her footsteps barely audible on the polished wooden floor. Several people, deep in conversation about the latest art exhibit in the city, stand nearby as Elliot, holding a drink that appears to be a classic scotch on the rocks, walks up behind her. Lee slips past Elliot and walks away. Elliot looks back at her briefly, feeling a sense of unresolved tension, then, sipping his drink, he turns and looks offscreen at the crowd in the elegantly furnished living room. Holly is standing in the pantry, preparing some offscreen food with the precision of a seasoned chef, when Hannah walks into view, headed for the refrigerator, carrying two heirloom tomatoes. Hannah opens the refrigerator, totally ignoring Holly, then walks over to the table, gathering up more food including an assortment of fresh herbs and vegetables. Holly walks over to the sink and washes her hands, following the hygiene practices of a diligent cook, drying them as Hannah, her arms laden with produce, strides over to her sister. Hannah storms out a nearby door, her frustration palpable, as Holly turns away from the sink. Holly wipes her hand on the towel as Hannah reenters the kitchen, carrying even more vegetables, and strides into the pantry area, flopping the vegetables down on the counter in a burst of exasperation. Holly puts the dishtowel down and absently straightens some things on the food-laden table, ensuring everything is in its right place. Hannah angrily gathers up some spices from the table; Holly walks back onscreen holding a silver ice bucket, polished to a shine for the guests' beverages, stops at the corner of the table, and faces Hannah. Hannah picks up a large bowl and carries it, along with her armload of spices, into the pantry area. Hannah, reacting to the tense atmosphere, puts the spices down on the pantry counter while Holly turns away. Guests can be seen mingling and talking and helping themselves at a buffet table in the living room, which offers a variety of upscale dishes. Lee and Elliot can be heard offscreen as the camera slowly moves from the doorway across the empty dining room to reveal them in the midst of an intense conversation, perhaps about the complicated dynamics of their relationship. Lee goes over to an open door and closes it quickly, seeking privacy. The door opens and Mavis appears, holding a set of candlesticks, an elegant silver pair that adds a touch of sophistication to the decor. She walks over to the dining room table, which is already decked out with a floral centerpiece featuring seasonal blooms, glassware, and fine china, and puts them down as Lee and Elliot stand awkwardly near the door, waiting for her to leave, their conversation momentarily paused.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A couple stands by the curtain; one man gets up from his hammock and walks away. Some guests sip their smoothies, smiling, as the camera moves back to the harp and the painting-laden wall. Evan is playing the harp with exuberance while Norma, still standing behind him, has a poignant, wistful expression on her face. Mavis the gardener walks by with a basket of pastries, and the man takes one, mouthing his thanks, as the camera travels past the open cupboard, past two boys in blazers who are drinking lemonade and munching, to reveal Lee. She is leaning against another archway, a faraway look on her face as she listens to the music. Mavis passes in the hall beyond the archway. Several people, deep in conversation, stand nearby as Elliot, holding a teacup, walks up behind her. Lee slips past Elliot and walks away. Elliot looks back at her briefly, then, sipping his teacup, he turns and looks offscreen at the crowd in the gallery room. Holly is standing in the conservatory, preparing some offscreen dessert when Hannah walks into view, headed for the cupboard, carrying two cucumbers. Hannah opens the cupboard, totally ignoring Holly, then walks over to the counter, gathering up more ingredients. Holly walks over to the basin and washes her hands, drying them as Hannah, her arms laden with fruit, strides over to her sister. Hannah storms out a nearby entrance as Holly turns away from the basin. Holly wipes her hand on the napkin as Hannah reenters the conservatory, carrying even more fruit, and strides into the storage area, flopping the fruit down on the surface. Holly puts the napkin down and absently straightens some things on the dessert-laden counter. Hannah angrily gathers up some herbs from the counter; Holly walks back onscreen holding a bronze vase, stops at the corner of the counter, and faces Hannah. Hannah picks up a large platter and carries it, along with her armload of herbs, into the storage area. Hannah, reacting, puts the herbs down on the storage surface while Holly turns away. Guests can be seen mingling and talking and helping themselves at a snack stand in the gallery room. Lee and Elliot can be heard offscreen as the camera slowly moves from the doorway across the empty parlor to reveal them in the midst of an intense conversation. Lee goes over to a sliding door and closes it quickly. The door opens and Mavis appears, holding a pair of lanterns. She walks over to the parlor table, which is already decked out with a seashell centerpiece, ceramics, and silverware, and puts them down as Lee and Elliot stand awkwardly near the door, waiting for her to leave.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: A couple stands by the window; one man rises from his chair and wanders away. Some guests savor their drinks, chuckling, as the camera shifts back to the piano and the book-laden wall. Evan is serenading the piano with exuberance while Norma, still standing behind him, has a reflective, dreamy expression on her face. Mavis the maid saunters by with a tray of hors d'oeuvres, and the man selects one, mouthing his thanks, as the camera glides past the open bookshelf, past two boys in suits who are sipping soda and snacking, to reveal Lee. She is lounging against another doorway, a distant look on her face as she absorbs the music. Mavis ambles in the hall beyond the doorway. Several people, absorbed in conversation, linger nearby as Elliot, holding a drink, sidles up behind her. Lee slips past Elliot and meanders away. Elliot glances back at her briefly, then, sipping his drink, he shifts and gazes offscreen at the crowd in the living room. Holly is standing in the pantry, assembling some offscreen food when Hannah strides into view, aimed for the refrigerator, carrying two tomatoes. Hannah peers into the refrigerator, completely bypassing Holly, then ambles over to the table, collecting more food. Holly moves over to the sink and rinses her hands, drying them as Hannah, her arms brimming with vegetables, marches over to her sister. Hannah rushes out a nearby door as Holly swivels away from the sink. Holly wipes her hand on the towel as Hannah reenters the kitchen, carrying even more vegetables, and sweeps into the pantry area, casting the vegetables down on the counter. Holly lays the dishtowel down and idly arranges some items on the food-laden table. Hannah furiously moves some spices from the table; Holly returns onscreen holding a silver ice bucket, pauses at the corner of the table, and faces Hannah. Hannah seizes a large bowl and transports it, along with her collection of spices, into the pantry area. Hannah, reacting, sets the spices on the pantry counter while Holly pivots away. Guests can be seen circulating and chatting and serving themselves at a buffet table in the living room. Lee and Elliot can be heard offscreen as the camera leisurely pans from the doorway across the vacant dining room to reveal them in the midst of a heated conversation. Lee marches over to an open door and shuts it briskly. The door swings open and Mavis appears, clutching a set of candlesticks. She strides over to the dining room table, which is already adorned with a floral centerpiece, glassware, and china, and sets them down as Lee and Elliot hover awkwardly near the door, awaiting her departure.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A cactus stands by the trampoline; one raccoon gets up from its cloud and walks away. Some penguins sip their pumpkins, smiling, as the notebook moves back to the saxophone and the candle-laden mirror. Patricia is playing the saxophone with exuberance while Harold, still standing behind her, has a poignant, wistful expression on his tire. Brenda the gardener walks by with a tray of cupcakes, and the raccoon takes one, mouthing its thanks, as the notebook travels past the open chest, past two pigeons in sneakers who are drinking lemonade and munching, to reveal Sam. He is leaning against another hammock, a faraway look on his tire as he listens to the music. Brenda passes in the hallway beyond the hammock. Several lamps, deep in conversation, stand nearby as Frank, holding a pumpkin, walks up behind him. Sam slips past Frank and walks away. Frank looks back at him briefly, then, sipping his pumpkin, he turns and looks offscreen at the pillow in the igloo. Luna is standing in the attic, preparing some offscreen toys when Petra walks into view, headed for the closet, carrying two marbles. Petra opens the closet, totally ignoring Luna, then walks over to the rocket, gathering up more toys. Luna walks over to the bathtub and washes her shovels, drying them as Petra, her arms laden with buttons, strides over to her brother. Petra storms out a nearby window as Luna turns away from the bathtub. Luna wipes her shovel on the rag as Petra reenters the attic, carrying even more buttons, and strides into the attic area, flopping the buttons down on the drawer. Luna puts the rag down and absently straightens some things on the toy-laden rocket. Petra angrily gathers up some batteries from the rocket; Luna walks back onscreen holding a golden trophy, stops at the corner of the rocket, and faces Petra. Petra picks up a large jar and carries it, along with her armload of batteries, into the attic area. Petra, reacting, puts the batteries down on the attic drawer while Luna turns away. Hamsters can be seen mingling and talking and helping themselves at a buffet barrel in the igloo. Sam and Frank can be heard offscreen as the notebook slowly moves from the hammock across the empty barn to reveal them in the midst of an intense conversation. Sam goes over to an open curtain and closes it quickly. The curtain opens and Brenda appears, holding a set of yarn balls. She walks over to the barn rocket, which is already decked out with a floral candle, glassware, and china, and puts them down as Sam and Frank stand awkwardly near the curtain, waiting for her to leave.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: A group of cats lounges by the window; one penguin hops up from his hammock and slides away. Several spectators nibble their sandwiches, chuckling, as the drone circles back to the violin and the poster-covered wall. Oliver is dancing to the violin with enthusiasm while Greta, still perching above him, has a dreamy, pondering expression on her face. Mason the butler dances by with a platter of desserts, and the penguin selects one, nodding his approval, as the drone zooms past the vintage radio, past two otters in tuxedos who are sipping juice and crunching, to uncover Mia. She is reclining against another bureau, a distant look on her face as she taps to the music. Mason whirlwinds through the corridor beyond the bureau. Several creatures, lost in discussion, perch nearby as Arthur, holding a smoothie, glides up beside her. Mia tiptoes past Arthur and hops away. Arthur gazes after her briefly, then, sipping his smoothie, he rotates and gazes offscreen at the ensemble in the study. Claire is nesting in the pantry, concocting some offscreen garnish when Ingrid skips into sight, aiming for the freezer, juggling two apples. Ingrid flings open the freezer, utterly neglecting Claire, then waltzes over to the counter, amassing more garnish. Claire saunters over to the basin and rinses her paws, shaking them as Ingrid, her arms burdened with fruits, drifts over to her sibling. Ingrid strides out a side portal as Claire pivots from the basin. Claire shakes her paw on the cloth as Ingrid reappears in the pantry, burdened with even more fruits, and traipses into the preparation zone, tossing the plums onto the surface. Claire leaves the cloth behind and dreamily aligns some items on the garnish-laden counter. Ingrid furiously assembles some condiments from the counter; Claire skips back onscreen holding a golden punch bowl, halts at the edge of the counter, and addresses Ingrid. Ingrid seizes a hefty pot and lugs it, along with her collection of condiments, into the preparation zone. Ingrid, reacting, stows the condiments on the pantry bench while Claire pivots away. Observers can be seen mingling and chatting and serving themselves at a buffet station in the atrium. Mia and Arthur can be heard offscreen as the drone gradually glides from the entrance across the vacant dining area to exhibit them engrossed in a fervent dialogue. Mia strolls over to an open portal and slams it swiftly. The portal swings open and Mason materializes, juggling a pair of lanterns. He parades over to the dining area bench, already adorned with a floral centerpiece, silverware, and goblets, and sets them down as Mia and Arthur linger awkwardly near the portal, anticipating his departure.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption

Evan is strumming the harp with enthusiasm while Norma, still leaning over him, has a reflective, dreamy expression on her face. Several people, absorbed in debate, lounge nearby as Elliot, clutching a snack, sidles up behind her. Lee sidesteps Elliot and saunters away. Elliot glances back at her fleetingly, then, munching his snack, he spins and gazes offscreen at the gathering in the parlor. Holly is standing in the closet, assembling some offscreen gadgets when Hannah comes into view, headed for the cupboard, carrying two peppers. Hannah opens the cupboard, completely ignoring Holly, then struts over to the island, picking up more gadgets. Holly shuffles over to the faucet and rinses her fingers, wiping them as Hannah, her arms full of fruits, hurries over to her sibling. Hannah rushes out a nearby portal as Holly pivots away from the faucet. Holly pats her hand on the rag as Hannah reenters the room, clutching even more fruits, and marches into the closet area, dropping the fruits down on the counter. Holly lays the rag down and absentmindedly rearranges some items on the gadget-laden island. Hannah angrily seizes some herbs from the island; Holly returns onscreen holding a silver tray, pauses at the edge of the island, and faces Hannah. Hannah picks up a large pan and transports it, along with her armful of herbs, into the closet area. Hannah, reacting, places the herbs down on the closet counter while Holly twists away. Guests can be seen mingling and chatting and indulging themselves at a dessert table in the parlor. Lee and Elliot can be overheard offscreen as the camera gently shifts from the portal across the vacant breakfast nook to reveal them in the midst of a fervent discussion. Lee approaches an open hatch and slams it swiftly. The hatch swings open and Mavis enters, holding an array of lanterns. She drifts over to the breakfast nook table, which is already adorned with a fruit centerpiece, cutlery, and pottery, and sets them down as Lee and Elliot linger awkwardly near the hatch, waiting for her to depart.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A turtle lounges by the fountain; one rabbit leaps up from its hammock and sprints away. Some flamingos chew their crackers, chuckling, as the drone zooms back to the harp and the map-covered ceiling. Oliver is sketching the harp with zeal while Wanda, still perched beside him, has a reflective, dreamy expression on her face. Lucy the librarian prances by with a cluster of balloons, and the rabbit grabs one, mouthing his gratitude, as the drone floats past the dusty dictionary, past three squirrels in pajamas who are sipping milk and crunching, to uncover Morgan. She is perched against another staircase, a pensive look on her face as she absorbs the poetry. Lucy skips by in the hallway beyond the staircase. A few owls, deep in silence, perch nearby as Max, holding a coconut, skips up beside her. Morgan sidesteps Max and glides away. Max glances back at her briefly, then, nibbling his coconut, he rotates and gazes offscreen at the parade in the courtyard. Donna is lounging in the cellar, assembling some hidden jigsaws when Flora dances into view, headed for the cupboard, clutching two oranges. Flora opens the cupboard, completely disregarding Donna, then glides over to the bench, scooping up more puzzles. Donna slides over to the faucet and splashes her wings, shaking them dry as Flora, her limbs cradling fruits, dances over to her aunt. Flora dashes out a secret hatch as Donna swivels away from the faucet. Donna brushes her wing on the dishcloth as Flora reenters the cellar, carrying even more fruits, and twirls into the jigsaw zone, cascading the fruits down on the console. Donna places the dishcloth down and aimlessly tidies some items on the toy-covered bench. Flora irritably sweeps up some figurines from the bench; Donna strolls back onscreen clutching a shiny bell, pauses at the edge of the bench, and regards Flora. Flora lifts a gigantic plate and transports it, along with her heap of figurines, into the jigsaw zone. Flora, responding, places the figurines down on the jigsaw counter while Donna rotates away. Owls can be spotted mingling and whispering and feasting at a treasure chest in the courtyard. Morgan and Max can be heard offscreen as the drone slowly zips from the staircase through the vacant lounge to uncover them immersed in a passionate poetry recital. Morgan drifts over to a secret portal and seals it hurriedly. The portal swings open and Lucy emerges, brandishing a trio of lanterns. She prances over to the lounge counter, which is already adorned with a starry mobile, goblets, and carvings, and places them down as Morgan and Max hover awkwardly by the portal, waiting for her to vanish.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A couple stands by a window while guests enjoy drinks. Evan plays the piano with enthusiasm, as Norma watches with a wistful expression. Mavis, the maid, offers hors d'oeuvres, passing guests and two boys with soda. Lee leans against a doorway, lost in thought as she listens to the music. Elliot approaches her but she walks away, leaving him to observe the crowd. In the kitchen, Holly prepares food while Hannah, ignoring her, gathers vegetables and storms out. Holly tidies up, as Hannah returns with more veggies, angrily collecting spices. They continue their tasks as guests mingle and serve themselves at a buffet. Lee and Elliot engage in an intense conversation. Lee closes a door, and Mavis enters with candlesticks, placing them on a dining table set for dinner. Lee and Elliot wait for her to leave, standing awkwardly by the door.
